full_threads.body:
Hi Joel,



Thanks for the quick turnaround with this.


Is there any way we can keep the same header image from the original page on the NDC site? (replace the guy with the chain?)


Otherwise all looks good.



Stuart


https://cbo.me/images/logo.png


Stuart Halley
Head of Performance


P: 1300 660 285 · M: 0434 043 385


Level 13, 333 George St, Sydney NSW

Hi Stuart, 


We have the updated the changes.


Here are the quick links for you to check.
https://www.dbdental.com.au/
https://www.dbdental.com.au/claim-your-free-consult-invisalign/


Let me know if this is ok? 


Cheers!

Hi Heath,



Thanks for the call and sorry for bombarding you this morning.


To confirm we are adding text to the video slider and not replacing. Can you please add the below text to the DBDenatal homepage video banner and change the white text to grey (#646567)?



  • $5,995 payable over 24 months – no surprises – that’s less than $7 a day.


If we can also copy the below landing page from the NDC website to DBD and then update the button URL in the video slider to link to this new page that would be great.



  • https://www.nationaldentalcare.com.au/claim-your-free-consult-invisalign/


Any questions please reach out and apologies once again for hounding you this morning.


Your help is massively appreciated!



Stuart


https://cbo.me/images/logo.png


Stuart Halley
Head of Performance


P: 1300 660 285 · M: 0434 043 385


Level 13, 333 George St, Sydney NSW

Hi Heath,


Thanks for looking into this and for the updates. Seems to be loading fine now but I noticed there are still errors in WordPress when I try and update the plugin.


Also, does the new video slider sit in the same WordPress account? I can’t seem to get my changes below to update in the live environment:\



  1. On the video banner can you change the ‘See the difference with Invisalign” text to be the DB Dental grey. (#646567)



  1. Please also change this text to say…


i. $5,995 payable over 24 months – no surprises – that’s less than $7 a day.



  1. Can we copy the below page over to the DBDental website?



  1. https://www.nationaldentalcare.com.au/claim-your-free-consult-invisalign/


Any updates would be great as I am worried the migrated site has some bugs in the backend now and is a security risk with the Slider Revolution plugin being Out of Date/ broken.


Feel free to give me a call if it’s easier as I am in-between meetings right now.


Cheers,


Stuart


https://cbo.me/images/logo.png


Stuart Halley
Head of Performance


P: 1300 660 285 · M: 0434 043 385


Level 13, 333 George St, Sydney NSW

Hi Stuart, 


We have built our own video slider for the home page as a work around to Revolution Slider. Interestingly, we still couldn't replicate the bug at our end on any browsers. Anyway, please refresh and let me know how it goes? 


Thanks and speak soon,
Joel Maligalig I can’t recreate this error so haven’t been able to fix... it might be a PC only issue. Can you please check? Thanks

Hi Stuart, 


Sure, we have reverted to the previous home page slider. I think there is an issue with their current version of Revolution Slider. It's out of date, but there is no license installed. We will put a work around in place to bypass Revolution Slider on the home page and let you know once it's done. 


Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath,




Correct, I have tried deleting cookies and tried on my personal laptop at home which has never loaded the website before on both Chrome and IE + mobile. Still receiving the same error. Attached is a screenshot of what I am seeing. I also tried logging into the back-end to see if it was an issue with updating the plugin code which spat an error out about the files not being found.




Any chance we can out the old homepage slider back live whilst we fix this one?




Regards,
Stuart


0434043385

Hi Stuart,


It’s loading fine at our end, but we will investigate it further. Are you seeing the error in IE? And have you cleared your cache?


Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath/ Support team,


We still have the same error this morning with the below message appearing in the video slider:


"Vimeo Froogaloop Api Could not be loaded ! Please Check and Renew SSL Certificate!"


Can we get this looked at urgently this morning please as the client has already flagged the page not loading correctly.


Thanks,
Stuart

0434043385

Ok great. We have updated the home slider on the staging site: https://dbdental.wpperk.com/

When you are ready, all we need you to do is to update the DNS records like we did with the NDC website.

Can you please work with the client to update the A-record to 35.189.58.105.



In the meantime, we will ready the site for launch, so the staging URL above will become inactive in around 15min or so, this is completely normal.



Thanks and speak soon,

Heath Maguire

On 20 Aug 2018, at 12:36 pm, <stuart@cbo.me> <stuart@cbo.me> wrote:

Hi Heath,

We just got word that the SSL certificate on site was provided by another provider, and since DBDental are not the custodians of the SSL certificate it would be lost during the migration.
We’ve been advised that the attached wildcard certificate should be sufficient to use instead.

  • Password: D0cu5h4r#

As a heads up, DBDental are keen to use the same Slider Revolution banner that is currently live on the NationalDentalCare.com.au homepage.

Once the migration is complete and successful, can we look to get this updated as the first update?

Good to go on the migration so please move forward and reach out if you need anything specifically.


Regards,
Stuart

https://cbo.me/images/logo.png

Stuart Halley

Hi Heath,

It's been a bit hectic the past month but we have another website to migrate from the NationalDentalCare family. This is relevant to http://dbdental.com.au/ as we previously discussed.

The current DBD website is still on a shared server with the same hosting provider as NDC had (Crucial) and we would be looking to mirror the setup for NDC in terms of hosting and support.

Before I create a new booking via wpperk.com, I just wanted to run this past you from a support perspective and make sure we were good to move forward?

Any questions please give me a call.

Regards,
Stuart
